# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_internal/utils/filetypes.py
@source-hash: 8bc5c04347850a88
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:58:34Z

## Purpose
Centralized filetype definitions and archive detection for pip's internal operations. Provides constants for supported archive formats and utilities to identify archive files.

## Key Components

### Constants (L8-19)
- `WHEEL_EXTENSION` (L8): Python wheel format identifier (".whl")
- `BZ2_EXTENSIONS` (L9): Bzip2 compressed archive formats (".tar.bz2", ".tbz")
- `XZ_EXTENSIONS` (L10-16): XZ/LZMA compressed formats including ".tar.xz", ".txz", ".tlz", ".tar.lz", ".tar.lzma"
- `ZIP_EXTENSIONS` (L17): ZIP formats including wheels (".zip", ".whl")
- `TAR_EXTENSIONS` (L18): Tar archive formats (".tar.gz", ".tgz", ".tar")
- `ARCHIVE_EXTENSIONS` (L19): Consolidated tuple of all supported archive formats

### Functions
- `is_archive_file(name: str) -> bool` (L22-27): Determines if a filename represents a supported archive format by checking file extension against known archive types

## Dependencies
- `pip._internal.utils.misc.splitext`: Used for filename extension extraction
- `typing.Tuple`: Type annotation for extension tuples

## Architecture Notes
- Immutable constant definitions enable consistent filetype checking across pip
- Case-insensitive extension matching via `.lower()` (L24)
- Hierarchical extension grouping by compression/archive type for maintainability
- Single source of truth for supported archive formats prevents inconsistencies
